properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 10 at 11:38PM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Huntsville AL
properties.description:
...Potential for life threatening flash flooding remains very
high across the Tennessee Valley...

.A large area of moderate to locally heavy rain and embedded
thunderstorms will continue to spread northeastward across the
Tennessee Valley overnight, producing rainfall rates on the order
of 1 to 2 inches per hour. This will greatly enhance the threat
for flash flooding across the entire region through daybreak.
Rainfall will gradually end from northwest to southeast during the
day tomorrow, as a cold front pushes southeastward.

The Flash Flood Watch continues for

* All counties in northern Alabama as well as Franklin, Lincoln,
and Moore counties in southern middle Tennessee.

* Through 6 PM CST Tuesday.

* Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches through daybreak, along
with locally higher amounts.

* This amount of rainfall will enhance the risk for flash
flooding. Avoid low lying and poor drainage areas, and be
careful when approaching low spots in highways and underpasses.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. Turn around, don't drown!

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 PM CST TUESDAY
